line_1: I hate to abuse — and I never can flatter:
line_2: I write for no Party, nor either bespatter.

line_1: Strange if they love the breath that cannot flatter!
line_2: But courtiers hate the puffing tribe, — no matter,

line_1: Alike, if they revile or flatter,
line_2: (Who lie in praise, will lie in satire)

line_1: Must stupid Stocks be taught to flatter?
line_2: Why all this Fury? What's the Matter,

line_1: And yet she chose the fool to flatter,
line_2: To make him fancy some great matter,

line_1: And yet she chose the fool to flatter,
line_2: And hope in time he might get at her;

line_1: I hate to hear you flatter.
line_2: I pray on me make satire;

line_1: Oft at morn ourselves we flatter,
And when you'd think He means to flatter,
